API#

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.preprocess Module#

Performs preprocessing pipeline

Classes#

EuclideanTransform([matrix, rotation, ...])

Euclidean transformation, also known as a rigid transform.

PreprocessData([input_path, filename, ...])

Class to run processing pipeline on data set.

datetime(year, month, day[, hour[, minute[, ...)

The year, month and day arguments are required.

Variables#

ABBREVIATIONS

INVERSE_OUTPUT_MAP

OUTPUT_MAP

Class Inheritance Diagram#

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.center_finding Module#

Methods for finding the center of the diffraction pattern.

Functions#

circular_average(image, center[, order])

Returns a circularly averaged version of the input image.

create_circular_mask(nrows, ncols[, center, ...])

Creates a circular mask for a pixel array with shape (nrows,ncols) Center can be specified as float tuple (row_center, col_center) rmin and rmax can be float Mask elements are True when distance from center is between rmin and rmax (inclusive)

radial_histogram(intensities, center)

Given a 2D array of intensities, return the radial histogram for each intensity value along with the corresponding radii

unwarp_polar(img[, origin, output_shape, ...])

Convert image from polar to cartesian.

warp_polar(image[, center, radius, ...])

Remap image to polar or log-polar coordinates space.

Variables#

RMAX_BEAM

int([x]) -> integer int(x, base=10) -> integer

RMIN_BEAM

int([x]) -> integer int(x, base=10) -> integer

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.denoising Module#

Methods for denoising the diffraction pattern

Functions#

azimuthal_integration(image[, center, ...])

Performs 2D -> 1D azimuthal integration yielding mean intensity as a function of radius

create_circular_mask(nrows, ncols[, center, ...])

Creates a circular mask for a pixel array with shape (nrows,ncols) Center can be specified as float tuple (row_center, col_center) rmin and rmax can be float Mask elements are True when distance from center is between rmin and rmax (inclusive)

filter_outlier_pixel_values(image[, mask, ...])

Filters outlier pixels with values that are either too high or too low.

filter_outlier_pixel_values_dir([...])

Repairs dead pixels in images contained in a directory

find_center(img[, mask_center, method, ...])

Find the center of an image in matrix notation

find_outlier_pixel_values(image[, mask, ...])

Filters outlier pixels with values that are either too high or too low.

gen_batches(n, batch_size, *[, min_batch_size])

Generator to create slices containing batch_size elements from 0 to n.

generic_filter(input, function[, size, ...])

Calculate a multidimensional filter using the given function.

medfilt2d(input[, kernel_size])

Median filter a 2-dimensional array.

Classes#

BaseEstimator()

Base class for all estimators in scikit-learn.

FilterOutlierPixelValues(*[, copy, center, ...])

Adapted from scikit-learn transforms Repair dead pixel areas of detector Replace dead pixels by np.nan

OneToOneFeatureMixin()

Provides get_feature_names_out for simple transformers.

TransformerMixin()

Mixin class for all transformers in scikit-learn.

datetime(year, month, day[, hour[, minute[, ...)

The year, month and day arguments are required.

Class Inheritance Diagram#

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.image_processing Module#

Functions#

bright_pixel_count(image[, qmin, qmax, offset])

Return the number of pixels between qmin and qmax

concatenate_detector_images(image1, image2, ...)

Code to concatenate images from two detectors.

crop_image(img, height, width[, center])

Crops an image to a given height and width about a center

enlarge_image(image, center[, nan])

map_coordinates(input, coordinates[, ...])

Map the input array to new coordinates by interpolation.

pad_image(img[, method, padding, center, nan])

Add zeros to image Default behavior is if padding is not specified, then pad image symmetrically to prevent image loss in case of rotation and cropping to original size.

warp(image, inverse_map[, map_args, ...])

Warp an image according to a given coordinate transformation.

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.peak_finding Module#

Code to find a peak by taking a dot-product with a Gaussian

Functions#

find_1d_peaks(radial_profile[, window_size, ...])

Find a single peak in a 1D array This uses index notation.

find_2d_peak(image[, roi, window_size])

Variables#

multivariate_normal

A multivariate normal random variable.

norm

A normal continuous random variable.

eosdxanalysis.preprocessing.utils Module#

Preprocessing utility functions

Functions#

count_intervals(num_array[, count])

Given an array of integers, return the number of intervals Example: - num_array = [0,1,2,6,7,10,12,16,17,18] - output: 5

create_circular_mask(nrows, ncols[, center, ...])

Creates a circular mask for a pixel array with shape (nrows,ncols) Center can be specified as float tuple (row_center, col_center) rmin and rmax can be float Mask elements are True when distance from center is between rmin and rmax (inclusive)

find_center(img[, mask_center, method, ...])

Find the center of an image in matrix notation

find_centroid(points)

Given an array of shape (n,2), with elemenets aij, [[a00,a01], [a10,a11], ...], calculate the centroid in row, column notation.

find_maxima(img, mask_center[, rmin, rmax])

gen_rotation_line([center, angle, radius])

Function to generate line for plotting purposes using x,y coordinates. Parameters: - center: (x0,y0) where origin is top-left (north-west or nw) horizontal is x0, vertical down is y0 - angle: (theta) [degrees] for standard lower-left origin - radius: (radius) Returns: - line_points: ([x1,x2],[y1,y2]) a tuple of the line endpoints.

get_angle(feature1, feature2)

Calculate the angle between two features, angle is for standard origin lower-left

polar_meshgrid([output_shape, r_count, ...])

Creates a polar meshgrid with unique label per cell.

quadrant_fold(image)

radial_integration(image[, center, output_shape])

Performs radial integration

relative_center([center_det1, ...])

Calculate the relative beam position with respect to detector 2.

rotate(image, angle[, resize, center, ...])

Rotate image by a certain angle around its center.

unwarp_polar(img[, origin, output_shape, ...])

Convert image from polar to cartesian.

warp_polar(image[, center, radius, ...])

Remap image to polar or log-polar coordinates space.

warp_polar_preprocessor(image[, center, ...])

Performs warp polar preprocessing for azimuthal integration and radial intensity functions.

zerocross1d(x, y[, getIndices])

Find the zero crossing points in 1d data.

int([x]) -> integer int(x, base=10) -> integer

END_ANGLE_DEFAULT
